name: M8/M20/M21
description: The summer Milky Way offers an embarrassment of riches, well illustrated by this image which captures no less than three Messier objects in a single frame. In the lower left, the Lagoon Nebula (M8) is a sprawling cloud of hydrogen, giving birth to a new generation of stars. At center right, the Trifid Nebula (M20) is a hybrid emission (red) and reflection (blue) nebula. Finally, directly above M20 is the sparse but bright open star cluster M21.
